page.title: 10Farming continued
page.content: A quarter of the land in the area is park land. Some of this is cultivated and the remainder is either woodland or grazing. There are some areas of woodland which is mostly cared for by the Forestry Commission or the Flint- shire Woodlands who cope with the planting and the harvesting of the trees. This is another form of employ -ment in the area. There are deer roaming in the woodlands around the park and a Deer Ranger is employed for the caring and culling of the deer. A Water Bailiff controls the fishing in the River Elwy and a Gamekeeper is employed on the Kinmel Estate for the rearing and shooting of pheasants (a private shoot). The local Fint and Denbigh Hunt controls the fox population in the area.
